character.name: Barbarian
character.inventory:
Starting Weapon: Broadsword; 
Starting Armor: None;
character.description: You are the Barbarian, the greatest warrior of all. But beware of magic, for your sword is no defense against it.

character.name: Elf
character.inventory:
Starting Weapon: Shortsword; 
Starting Armor: None;
character.description: You are the Elf, a master of both magic and the sword. You must use both well if you are to triumph. You have the power to cast 3 magical spells, all relating to one natural element.

character.name: Dwarf
character.inventory:
Starting Weapon: Shortsword; 
Starting Armor: None;
character.description: You are the Dwarf. You are a good warrior and have the unique ability to disarm traps without a tool kit. To do so, you must avoid rolling a black shield on a combat die.

character.name: Wizard
character.inventory:
Starting Weapon: Dagger; 
Starting Armor: None;
character.description: You are the Wizard. You have the power to cast many different spells. In combat, however, you are weak. You cannot wear armor or use large weapons. Therefore, you must cast your spells wisely and avoid physical combat.

monster.name: Chaos Warrior
monster.description: These are men who have become monsters-slaves to darkness. They are always heavily armored and often bear weapons enchanted with Chaos magic. These dread Warriors strike fear into all but the bravest (or most foolish) of opponents.

monster.name: Fimir
monster.description: These one-eyed, lizard-like creatures are stronger even than Orcs. They are sometimes found leading small bands of Orcs and Goblins but are dangerous enough even when encountered singly.

monster.name: Gargoyle
monster.description: These foul creatures are produced by Chaos magic. In essence, they are stone statues of great monsters, brought to life through arcane rituals. Their stone skin makes them very hard to wound in combat.

monster.name: Goblin
monster.description: These green-skinned creatures are small and cruel. Despite their small size and lack of brute strength, they are dangerous foes. Orcs have enslaved many Goblin tribes, and the two are often found together.

monster.name: Goblin (Axe)
monster.description: These green-skinned creatures are small and cruel. Despite their small size and lack of brute strength, they are dangerous foes. Orcs have enslaved many Goblin tribes, and the two are often found together.

monster.name: Mummy
monster.description: Embalmed and preserved by secret and magical arts, Mummies are controlled by a more powerful version of the magic that animates Zombies and Skeletons. They are very hard to overcome in single-handed combat.

monster.name: Orc
monster.description: Orcs are related to Goblins, but are larger and much more powerfull. They form the rank and file of Zargon's armies and delight in cruelty and slaughter. Savage and vicious warriors, Orcs should never he underestimated.

monster.name: Orc (Cleaver)
monster.description: Orcs are related to Goblins, but are larger and much more powerfull. They form the rank and file of Zargon's armies and delight in cruelty and slaughter. Savage and vicious warriors, Orcs should never he underesimated.

monster.name: Skeleton
monster.description: The animated remains of long dead warriors, Skeletons form the bulk of the Armies of the Undead. They are slow but relentless, controlled by Chaos magic.

monster.name: Zombie
monster.description: Like Skeletons, Zombies are magically animated corpses. Unlike Skeletons, some still bear traces of decaying flesh and muscle. Their movements are slow and awkward and they carry wherever they go.

monster.name: Warlock
monster.description: This figure will he used as several different characters (both good and bad) in various Quests.

spell.name: Ball of Flame
spell.description: This spell can be cast on any one Hero. It will inflict 2 Body Points of damage. The hero immediately rolls two red dice. For each 5 or 6 rolled, the damage is reduced by 1 point.

spell.name: Command
spell.description: This spell puts any one Hero under Zargon's control. The spell can be broken immediately or on a future turn by the Hero rolling one red die for each of his Mind Points. However, until the spell is broken, Zargon, on his turn, can move the Hero as as monster and attack other Heroes.

spell.name: Fear
spell.description: This spell causes any one Hero to become so fearful that his attacks are reduced to one combat die. The spell can be broken by the Hero on a future turn by rolling one red die for each of his Mind Points. If a 6 is rolled, the spell is broken.

spell.name: Lightning Bolt
spell.description: This spell may be cast in a horizontal, vertical, or diagonal direction. The bolt will travel in a straight line until it strikes a wall or closed door. It will inflict 2 points of body damage on all Heroes or monsters that stand in its path.

spell.name: Cloud of Chaos
spell.description: This spell paralyzes all Heroes located in the same room or corridor. A paralyzed Hero is unable to move, attack, or defend himself. The spell can be broken at once or on a future turn by each victim rolling one red die for each of his Mind Points. By rolling a 6, the Hero frees himself.

spell.name: Escape
spell.description: This spell allows the spellcaster to disappear and instantly teleport to a secret destination know only to Zargon. This "safe place" is marked on the Quest Map.

spell.name: Firestorm
spell.description: This spell creates a roomful of fire that inflicts 3 Body Points of damage on all Heroes and monsters in the same room with the spellcaster. The spellcaster is unaffected. All victims immediately roll two red dice. For each 5 or 6 rolled, the damage is reduced by 1 point. Not used in corridors.

spell.name: Rust
spell.description: This spell causes any one metal sword or helmet to become so thin, brittle and useless that ir can never be used again. Not effective against Artifacts.

spell.name: Sleep
spell.description: This spell puts any one Hero into a deep sleep. A sleeping Hero is unable to move, attack, or defend himself. The spell can be broken, immediately, or on a future turn by the Hero rolling one red die for each of his Mind Points. If a 6 is rolled, the spell is broken.

spell.name: Summon Undead
spell.description: This spell conjures up a group of undead to surround and protect the spellcaster. Roll one red die: Roll a 1 or 2 = 4 Skeletons; Roll a 3 or 4 = 3 Skeletons, 2 Zombies; Roll a 5 or 6 = 2 Zombies, 2 Mummies.

spell.name: Summon Orcs
spell.description: This spell conjures up a group of Orcs to surround and protect the spellcaster. Roll one red die: Roll a 1, 2 or 3 = 4 Orcs; Roll a 4 or 5 = 5 Orcs; Roll a 6 = 6 Orcs;

spell.name: Tempest
spell.description: This spell creates a small whirlwind that envelops one Hero of your choice. That Hero will then miss his next turn.

spell.name: Genie
spell.description: This spell conjures up a Genie who will do one of the following: open any door on board (revealing what lies beyond), OR use 5 combat dice to attack any monster within your line of sight.

spell.name: Tempest
spell.description: This spell creates a small whirlwind that envelops one monster of your choice. That monster will then miss its next turn.

spell.name: Swift Wind
spell.description: This spell may be cast on any one Hero, including yourself. Its powerful burst of energy enables that Hero to roll twice as many red dice as normal the next time he moves.

spell.name: Heal Body
spell.description: This spell may be cast on any one Hero, including yourself. Its magical power will immediately restore up to 4 lost Body Points, but does not give a Hero more than his starting number.

spell.name: Rock Skin
spell.description: This spell may be cast on any one Hero, including yourself. That Hero may throw one extra combat die when defending. The spell is broken when the Hero suffers 1 point of Body damage.

spell.name: Pass Through Rock
spell.description: This spell may be cast on any one Hero, including yourself. That Hero may then move through walls on his next move. He may move through as many walls as his dice roll allow. Caution! There are shaded areas on each Quest Map which indicate solid rock. If a hero ends his move in one of these areas, he is trapped forever!

spell.name: Ball of Flame
spell.description: This spell may be cast on any one monster, enveloping it in a ball of fire. It will inflict 2 Body Points of damage. The monster the rolls two red dice. For each 5 or 6 rolled, the damage is reduced by 1 point.

spell.name: Fire of Wrath
spell.description: This spell may be cast on any one monster, blasting it with flames. It will inflict 1 Body Point of damage, unless the monster can immediately roll a 5 or 6 using one red die.

spell.name: Courage
spell.description: This spell may be cast on any one Hero, including yourself. The next time that Hero attacks, he may roll two extra combat dice. The spell is broken the moment the Hero can no longer "see" a monster.

spell.name: Sleep
spell.description: This spell puts a monster into a deep sleep so it cannot move, attacks, or defend itself. The spell can be broken at once or on a future turn by a monster rolling one red die for each of its Mind Points. If a 6 is rolled, the spell is broken. May not be used against Mummies, Zombies or Skeletons.

spell.name: Water of Healing
spell.description: This spell may be cast on any one Hero, including yourself. Contact with this revitalizing water will restore up to 4 lost Body Points, but will not give a Hero more than his starting number.

spell.name: Veil of Mist
spell.description: This spell may be cast on any one Hero, including yourself. On the Hero's next move, he may move unseen through spaces that are occupied by monsters.

treasure.name: Gem!
treasure.description: Tucked into the toe of an old boot you find a small gem worth 35 gold coins. Record the money on you sheet. Do not return this card to the deck.

treasure.name: Heroic Brew
treasure.description: You are surprised to find a leather bag hanging on the wall. If you drink its contents before you attack, you can make two attacks instead of one. This may only be used once. Do not return this card to the deck.

treasure.name: Jewels!
treasure.description: You find a small wooden box. It is simple-looking and very old. Within you discover that it is lined with velvet and contains very small jewels worth 50 gold coins. Record the money on your sheet. Do not return this card to the deck.

treasure.name: Potion of Defense
treasure.description: Amidst a collection of old bottles, you find a small vial containing a clear liquid. You can drink this potion at any time, giving you two extra combat dice the next time you defend. This may only be used once. Do not return this card to the deck.

treasure.name: Potion of Healing
treasure.description: In a bundle of rags, you find a small bottle of bluish liquid. You can drink this healing potion at any time, restoring the number of Body Points equal to a roll of one red die. You cannot, however, exceed your starting number of Body Points. This may only be used once. Do not return this card to the deck.

treasure.description: As you are searching, a monster stalks you and attacks! Zargon places the wandering monster (listed in the Quest Book) on any square next to you. The monster attacks immediately! Return this card to the bottom of the deck.

artifact.name: Borin's Armor
artifact.description: This magical suit of plate mail allows the wearer to roll four combat dice in defense. Unlike normal plate mail, this mysterious, ultralight metal armor does not slow down its wearer. May not be used by Wizard.

artifact.name: Orc's Bane
artifact.description: When using this magical shortsword, you roll two combat dice to attack. You may attack twice if attacking an Orc. May not be used by Wizard.

artifact.name: Spell Ring
artifact.description: This ring enables the Wizard or Elf to cast one spell two times (not simultaneously). At the beggining of a Quest, the wearer of this ring must declare which of his spell he is storing in the ring.

artifact.name: Talisman of Lore
artifact.description: This magical medallion increases your Mind Points by 1 for as long as it is worn.

artifact.name: Elixir of Life
artifact.description: This small bottle of pearly liquid will bring a dead Hero back to life, restoring all of his Body and Mind Points. This potion can only be used once.

artifact.name: Ring of Return
artifact.description: When invoked, this magical ring will return all Heroes that the ring wearer can "see" to the starting point of the Quest. It can only be used once.

artifact.name: Spirit Blade
artifact.description: This magical broadsword has an eerie handle of carved bone. When using it, roll three combat dice to attack, or roll four combat dice if attacking an undead monster (Skeleton, Zombie, or Mummy). May not be used by Wizard.

artifact.name: Wand of Magic
artifact.description: This magical wand allows the Elf or Wizard to cast two separate and different spells on his turn instead of one single spell.

artifact.name: Wizard's Cloak
artifact.description: This magical cloak made of shimmery fabric is covered with mystical runes. It can be worn only by the Wizard, giving him one extra combat die in defense.

artifact.name: Wizard's Staff
artifact.description: This long ancient staff glows with a soft blue light. It can be used only by the Wizard, giving him the attack strength of two combat dice and the ability to strike diagonally.
